sub_topic: Calculating the molar mass of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the molar mass of FeSO4?
message_2:
To find the molar mass of FeSO₄ (Iron (II) sulfate), we need to add the molar masses of each element in the compound.

1. Iron (Fe): 1 atom × 55.845 g/mol = 55.845 g/mol
2. Sulfur (S): 1 atom × 32.066 g/mol = 32.066 g/mol
3. Oxygen (O): 4 atoms × 16.00 g/mol = 64.00 g/mol

Now, add the molar masses of each element together:

55.845 g/mol (Fe) + 32.066 g/mol (S) + 64.00 g/mol (O) = 151.911 g/mol

The molar mass of FeSO₄ is approximately 151.911 g/mol.
